oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Folk Festival Council of New York Sheet Music
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A typed song sheet packet for the Folk Festival Council of New York and the New School for Social Research. Contains the musical notation and lyrics to ten songs including "Louisiana Girls," "Dese Bones Gwine to Rise Again," "Weevily Wheat," "Shortenin' Bread," "Old Joe Clark," "Alabam Gal," "Comin' 'Round Th' Mountain," and "Turkey in the Straw." *Content warning for "Shortenin' Bread."

The Folk Festival Council of New York City was founded in 1932 to familiarize the city's immigrant communities and Americans in general with America's folk music tradition.the published a periodical Folk-News that covered both local and national folk music events.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Folk music; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Working class--Education; Working class--Songs and music; Labor movement; Labor movement--United States--History; Folk Festival Council of New York (New York, N.Y.); New School University; African Americans--Civil rights--Songs and music
